title: A Carabiner Battery
description: I thought I had seen every possible object that could incorporate a carabiner, but once again I've underestimated the EDC market. Nestout, a Japanese manufacturer of ruggedized power banks designed for the outdoors, has released this Carabiner Battery. "Designed to withstand the elements, it features IP44 water and dust resistance and a shock-absorbing silicone cushion, protecting it from unexpected drops and light rain. Its integrated metal carabiner clip allows you to conveniently attach it to your backpack or belt, ensuring you're hands-free and mobile." The 5000mAh battery weighs 6.4 oz and runs $45.
author: Rain Noe
excerpt: Surely we will run out of objects that can feature carabiners
text: A Carabiner Battery Surely we will run out of objects that can feature carabiners I thought I had seen every possible object that could incorporate a carabiner, but once again I've underestimated the EDC market. "Designed to withstand the elements, it features IP44 water and dust resistance and a shock-absorbing silicone cushion, protecting it from unexpected drops and light rain. Its integrated metal carabiner clip allows you to conveniently attach it to your backpack or belt, ensuring you're hands-free and mobile." The 5000mAh battery weighs 6.4 oz and runs $45. html:
A Carabiner Battery

Surely we will run out of objects that can feature carabiners

I thought I had seen every possible object that could incorporate a carabiner, but once again I've underestimated the EDC market. Nestout, a Japanese manufacturer of ruggedized power banks designed for the outdoors, has released this Carabiner Battery.

"Designed to withstand the elements, it features IP44 water and dust resistance and a shock-absorbing silicone cushion, protecting it from unexpected drops and light rain. Its integrated metal carabiner clip allows you to conveniently attach it to your backpack or belt, ensuring you're hands-free and mobile."

The 5000mAh battery weighs 6.4 oz and runs $45.
